member.name: T:Modbus.InvalidModbusRequestException
member.summary: An exception that provides the exception code that will be sent in response to an invalid Modbus request.

member.name: M:Modbus.InvalidModbusRequestException.#ctor(System.Byte)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified Modbus exception code.
member.param: The Modbus exception code to provide to the slave.

member.name: M:Modbus.InvalidModbusRequestException.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and Modbus exception code.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The Modbus exception code to provide to the slave.

member.name: M:Modbus.InvalidModbusRequestException.#ctor(System.Byte,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified Modbus exception code and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The Modbus exception code to provide to the slave.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:Modbus.InvalidModbusRequestException.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified Modbus exception code and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The Modbus exception code to provide to the slave.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.summary: Gets the Modbus exception code to provide to the slave.

member.name: T:Modbus.Data.DataStore
member.summary: Object simulation of device memory map. The underlying collections are thread safe when using the ModbusMaster API to read/write values. You can use the SyncRoot property to synchronize direct access to the DataStore collections.

member.summary: Serial Line only. Diagnostic function which loops back the original data. NModbus only supports looping back one ushort value, this is a limitation of the "Best Effort" implementation of the RTU protocol.

Address to begin reading (Holding registers are addressed starting at 0).
Address to begin writing (Holding registers are addressed starting at 0).
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: This constructor is called by the NullTransport.

member.summary: Number of times to retry sending message after encountering a failure such as an IOException, TimeoutException, or a corrupt message.

member.name: P:Modbus.IO.ModbusTransport.RetryOnOldResponseThreshold
member.summary: If non-zero, this will cause a second reply to be read if the first is behind the sequence number of the request by less than this number. For example, set this to 3, and if when sending request 5, response 3 is read, we will attempt to re-read responses.

member.name: P:Modbus.IO.ModbusTransport.SlaveBusyUsesRetryCount
member.summary: If set, Slave Busy exception causes retry count to be used. If false, Slave Busy will cause infinite retries

member.name: P:Modbus.IO.ModbusTransport.WaitToRetryMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds the tranport will wait before retrying a message after receiving an ACKNOWLEGE or SLAVE DEVICE BUSY slave exception response.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds before a timeout occurs when a read operation does not finish.
